verses.verse: Sing<WH7442>, O childless<WH6135>, you that did not carry<WH3205>; break forth<WH6476> into singing<WH7440>, and cry aloud<WH6670>, you that did not labor with child<WH2342>: for more<WH7227> are the sons<WH1121> of the desolate<WH8074> than the sons<WH1121> of the married wife<WH1166>, says<WH559> the Lord<WH3068>.

Enlarge<WH7337> the place<WH4725> of your tent<WH168>, and let them stretch forth<WH5186> the curtains<WH3407> of your habitations<WH4908>: spare<WH2820> not<WH748>, lengthen your cords<WH4340>, and strengthen<WH2388> your stakes<WH3489>;

In a little<WH8241> wrath<WH7110> I hid<WH5641> my face<WH6440> from you for a moment<WH7281>; but with everlasting<WH5769> kindness<WH2617> will I have mercy<WH7355> on you<WH559>, says the Lord<WH3068> your Redeemer<WH1350>.

And I will make<WH7760> your windows<WH8121> of agates<WH3539>, and your gates<WH8179> of carbuncles<WH68>, and all your borders<WH1366> of pleasant<WH2656> stones<WH68>.

Behold<WH1481>, they shall surely gather together<WH1481>, but not<WH657> by me<WH4310>: whoever shall gather together<WH1481> against you shall fall for your sake<WH5307>.
